nodes.message: This script is designed to be called more than once, but has "once per convo" options like Flirt. Using some script vars we can reset each time to control flow.

nodes.text: Just so you know, polite people greet their friends who are risking their lives for them with a Hi, how's it going? rather than a Did you find something?
Hi, Katie, how's it going?
It was going better before you spoke up.
Hi, Katie. Yes, I did find something I think you'll find very interesting...
Hi! I've had quite an adventure so far, and I found something you'll want to see.

options.text: Talk About the Half Pirate Map

nodes.text: I found the missing section of your map!
Really? I thought that was lost forever. Where did you find it?
I found it next to a dead body. It was still clutched in the dead man's hand.
That must have been Hellmouth's body. He's the one who stole the piece of the map... So Hellmouth made it all the way back to the Sea Caves only to die.
Serves him right for betraying his friends.
Let me see it!

options.text: Talk About the Half Pirate Map

nodes.text: Was that map piece I found any use to you?
Yeah, thanks. I'm not sure I could find the treasure without it - at least not before the semester ended.

options.text: Talk About the Red Skull Necklace

nodes.text: So, that "Dead Man's Chest" mentioned on the map... it was literal rather than figurative.
Say what?
I searched an old skeleton lying around and hidden in the ribcage was this red skull necklace... Look familiar?
It's just like the necklace my father gave me! These must be the red and green Death Head Gems that the map mentions! To think I had one all this time, and never knew it was tied to the map...
Thank you, Shawn! I just know we're going to find that treasure now!

nodes.message: Forcing this convo here instead of in it's own Menu Option so you can't skip it

nodes.text: Here we are again, alone in such a wild and beautiful place. It's a lot like you - a little bit dangerous and very enchanting.
Yeah, well, you're pretty dangerous and wild, yourself.
Your eyes sparkle like emeralds in the shimmering light. You're very pretty, you know that, don't you?
You really think so? I've always thought of myself as more of a plain, scrawny tomboy.
Katie, you are beautiful. Don't ever think otherwise.
We make a great team, you and I, Katie. We should spend more time together... a lot more time together...
Once we find the treasure, we'll be able to spend a lot of time together, you and I, Shawn.
See you later!
Good hunting!

nodes.message: TODO: Add journal entry for the poem

nodes.text: It says...

"Unlock the gate with Captain's Key, 
Yet first ye must have items three - 
The death head gems both green and red, 
The Tattooed Skull of Captain Dread."

"On Marlin Spike the Skull will be
Climb down the Mermaid's hair to see
Beyond the wall there's nothing left
But watery grave and certain death."
A watery grave and certain death? It doesn't say anything about treasure!
What, you expect a big "X marks the spot of the treasure?" Do you really think the pirates wanted someone else to use this map to steal their stolen booty?
This is great! Now all we need to do is find the gems and the tattooed skull to open the Death Wall's Gate and get to the treasure.
Don't forget... we need the Captain's key, too.
Oh, yes... and I'll bet that the pirate Captain at the ship's hull has that. With all the Zombies around there, it won't be easy to get the key from him.

nodes.name: Treasure Map!
nodes.description: Katie and I combined the pirate map pieces. I'd better make a copy here in my journal. There's something about climbing down a mermaid's hair to get to a marlin spike to find a skull. I thought pirates were lazy! We also need to get the Captain's key; likely he won't need it after all this time.

nodes.message: Forcing this convo here instead of in it's own Menu Option so you can't skip it
